titleStmt.title: The horrible murther of a young boy of three yeres of age, whose sister had her tongue cut out and how it pleased God to reueale the offendors, by giuing speech to the tongueles childe. Which offendors were executed at Hartford the 4. of August. 1606.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by E. Allde for VVilliam Firebrand, and are to be solde at his shop in the Popes-head alley, ouer against the tauerne doore,

notesStmt.note: Caption title reads: A true relation of the cruell murthering of a young boy, not fully three yeares olde, whose sister likewise had her tongue cut out of her head, hard by the rootes: which murther and massacre was done by a woman called Mother Dell, and her sonne, dwelling at Hatfield in Hartfordshire, .. .
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
